tutorial_text.text:
PLAYER SPECIALS

"Special Attacks" are performed with the "$specialBind" input.



Some characters may have a maneuver bound to the "special input" as an extra tool. A character with a bash, for instance,

can use it for a few purposes, such as interrupting enemy attacks or specials, or functioning as an opener to guarantee

an attack lands.



ENEMY SPECIALS

Enemies, too, can have a special attack that is performed on the "down attack" note in their charting.

The effect of this special can make a core difference in how the enemy must be approached.

The Shrub, for instance, has a bash as his special attack.

Bashes deal stamina damage and prevent blocking for a short time. A simple attack.



Pressing the "Down Guard" key (most likely the button to hit a down note) causes you to dodge.

Though the bash special is dodged using this input,

not all special attacks are countered with a dodge.
